00049 /// String describing rma background subtraction method
00050 #define RMABGSTR "rma-bg"
00051 /**
00052  *  RmaBgTran - Class for doing RMA style background subtraction.
00053  */
00054 class RmaBgTran : public ChipStream {
00055 
00056 public:
00057 
00058   /** 
00059    * @brief Constructor.
00060    * @param numBins - Number of bins to use in density estimation 16384 is magic
00061    *                  number from biocoductor, must be a power of two.
00062    */
00063   RmaBgTran(int numBins=16384);
00064 
00065   /** 
00066    * @brief Set which probes to use for the background estimation.
00067    * 
00068    * @param pmProbes Bitmask where PM probes are set to true.
00069    */
00070   void setPmProbes(const std::vector<bool> &pmProbes);
00071 
00072   /**
00073    * Setup the background probes and background gc indexes by reading
00074    * them from the blackboard
00075    */
00076   void setParameters(PsBoard &board);
00077 
00078   /** 
00079    * @brief transform the intensity point supplied coming from a particular
00080    * probe in a particular microarray.
00081    * 
00082    * @param probeIx - Probe index from the cel file.
00083    * @param chipIx - Set of chips from same sample.
00084    * @param intensity - Original intensities.
00085    * @param return - transformed intensities.
00086    */
00087   float transform(int probeIx, int chipIx, float intensity);
00088   void transform(int chipIx, std::vector<float>& intensity);
00089 
00090   void newChip(std::vector<float> &data);
00091 
00092   /** 
00093    * @brief Method for being passed a new cel file worth of data.
00094    * @param data - vector of vectors of cel file data from same sample.
00095    */
00096   void newDataSet(IntensityMart* iMart);
00097 
00098 /** 
00099  * @brief Method for adding cel file data to chipstream normalization method.
00100  * @param data - cel file vector of data.
00101  */
00102   void initializeData(const std::vector<float>& data);
00103 
00104   /** 
00105    * Fill in the information for Self documentation.
00106    * @param doc - Self documenter to be filled in.
00107    */
00108   static void setupSelfDoc(SelfDoc &doc) {
00109     doc.setDocName(RMABGSTR);
00110     doc.setDocDescription("Performs an RMA style background adjustment as described in Irizarry et al 2003.");
00111     // No parameters...
00112   }
00113 
00114   /** 
00115    * @brief Supply a little how/what/why about the algorithms this
00116    * class performs and what parameters it takes.
00117    * @return SelfDoc
00118    */
00119   static SelfDoc explainSelf() { 
00120     SelfDoc doc;
00121     setupSelfDoc(doc);
00122     return doc;
00123   }
00124 
00125   /** 
00126    * @brief This static function should be overridden by child classes
00127    * to return an object of the correct type initialized correctly
00128    * with the parameters in the string, string map. All objects
00129    * created this way should be deleted when finished using.
00130    * 
00131    * @param param - Map of key/value pairs to initialize the object.
00132    * 
00133    * @return Pointer toCreate object, this should be sub casted as necessary.
00134    */
00135   static SelfCreate *newObject(std::map<std::string,std::string> &param) { 
00136     if(param.size() != 0) { Err::errAbort(ToStr("No parameters for ") + ToStr(RMABGSTR)); }
00137     return new RmaBgTran();
00138   }
00139 
00140 private: 
00141 
00142   /// Parameters for an indivdual chip.
00143   struct ChipParam {
00144     double mu;     /// mode of "background" signal
00145     double sigma;  /// stdev of "background" signal
00146     double alpha;  /// mean of exponential "true" signal
00147   };
00148 
00149   /// Where parameters for each chip are stored.
00150   std::vector<struct ChipParam> m_Params;
00151   /// Bit mask where each pm probe is marked. 
00152   std::vector<bool> m_PmProbes;
00153   /// How many pm probes are there?
00154   int m_PmProbeCount;
00155   /// How many bins to use for RMA density estimation, must be power of two.
00156   int m_NumBins;
00157   
00158 };
